QUESTION_PAPER_INFORMATION.INSTRUCTIONS: * Each category has limited time as noted above. Once test starts, Time remaining for that category is displayed on top. Time remaining in one category will NOT be available for next category. * There is 1/4th negative marking; so please answer with caution. * 2 buttons appear below each question: 'Submit' - submits the answer, 'Next' - Moves to next question without submitting the answer. * To navigate across questions during test, please click on corresponding number in the block at the bottom of screen. Green boxes indicate answered questions and Red boxes indicate unanswered queations. You can change the answers to previously answered question

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: C,D,E,F,G,H, and I are father, mother, aunt, brother, sister, wife and daughter of J, but you do not know which is which. But you know that: E and F are the same gender C and D are of different genders H was born before C F is not the mother of J Which of the following must be true ?

You are planning to tour a country and wish to visit several of cities G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N and O with the following restrictions: You can not visit K and L in one tour You can not visit J,M and N in one tour You can not visit I,M and N in one tour You can not visit G and M in one tour Which of the following groups of cities can all be visited in one tour?
The average of 20 numbers is zero. Of them, at the most, how many may be greater than zero?

Step 1 : Multiply by 3 Step 2 : If less than 21, go to Step 1 and continue from there; otherwise proceed to step 3 step 3 : Divide by 2 Step 4 : Add 2 Which starting value will produce the largest result for the above process ?

A person can run 10 Kilometers per hour in 25-minute bursts, then must slow to 3 kilometers per hour for 5 minutes to regain energy. How many Kilometers (round to the nearest integer ) can this person cover in 5 hours ?
To avoid the race condition, the number of processes that may be simultaneously inside their critical section is
What is a process?

OPTIONS.OPTION: A program in High level language kept on disk

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The strategy of allowing processes that are logically runnable to be temporarily suspended is called
The LRU algorithm

OPTIONS.OPTION: pages out pages that have been used recently
pages out pages that have NOT been used recently
pages out pages that have been least used recently
pages out the first page in a given area

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: A system program that sets up an executable program in main memory ready for execution is
Fragmentation of the file system

OPTIONS.OPTION: occurs only if the file system is used improperly
can be temporarily removed by compaction
is a characteristic of all file systems

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: ON UPDATE CASCADE ensures which of the following?
Which SQL keyword is used with wildcards?
Which of the following are the five built-in functions provided by SQL?
Which of the following is used sort the results of a query?

OPTIONS.OPTION: None of the above is correct

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Examine the description of the EMPLOYEES table: EMP_ID NUMBER(4) NOT NULL LAST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) NOT NULL FIRST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) DEPT_ID NUMBER(2) JOB_CAT VARCHARD2(30) SALARY NUMBER(8,2) Which statement shows the maximum salary paid in each job category of each department?

OPTIONS.OPTION: SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE salary > MAX(salary);
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id, job_cat;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id;

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: In SQL, The HAVING clause does which of the following?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Acts like a WHERE clause but is used for groups rather than rows.
Acts like a WHERE clause but is used for rows rather than columns.
Acts like a WHERE clause but is used for columns rather than groups.
Acts EXACTLY like a WHERE clause.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: B+ or B-trees are preferred to binary trees in databases because

OPTIONS.OPTION: Disk capacities are greater than memory capacities
Disk access is much slower than memory access
Disk data transfer rates are much less than memory data transfer rates
Disks are more reliable than memory

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which of the following will compile without errors.
Given: int[ ][ ] items = { {0, 1, 3, 4}, {4, 3, 99, 0, 7 }, {3, 2} } ; Which of the following fragment replaces row 0 of items with an entirely new row?
Say that a method catches an IOException in a catch{ } block. Is it possible for that block to do some processing and then throw the same exception to the caller?

OPTIONS.OPTION: No---when an exception is caught the Exception object is destroyed.
No---an exception may be caught only once.
Yes---as long as the method also has a throws clause for that exception.
Yes---but the catch{ } block must construct a new Exception object.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which of the following are methods within the String class. (i) substring() (ii) startsWith() (iii) toString() (iv) toUpperCase() (v) indexOf()
Which statement is FALSE about the try{ } block?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Some of the statements in a try{} block will never throw an exception.
The statements in a try{ } block may throw several types of exception.
The statements in a try{ } block cannot include a loop.
The try{} block must be before the catch{ } blocks.
Duplicate method main(), compilation error at line 6.
Duplicate method main(), compilation error at line 11.
Prints "main method with main String[] args".
Prints "main method with main int[] args".

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which statement is FALSE about catch{} blocks?

OPTIONS.OPTION: There must be only one catch{} block in a try/catch structure.
The catch{} block for a child exception class must PRECEED that of a parent execption class.
The catch{} block for a child exception class must FOLLOW that of a parent execption class.
if there is no catch{} block there must be a finally{} block

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: What closing a file does?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Flushes pending output and finishes processing the file.
Flushes pending output, but the file may still be written to.
